meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being strange.
meanings.sent1: The strangeness of the situation left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent2: The town's strangeness was evident in its unique architecture.
meanings.sent3: The strangeness of the clown's outfit made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The strangeness of the old house gave it an eerie vibe.
meanings.sent5: The strangeness of the noise in the attic kept us on edge all night.

meanings.definition: The state or fact of being strange or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the strangeness of the new environment.
meanings.sent2: The strangeness of the language barrier made communication difficult.
meanings.sent3: The strangeness of the food left him hesitant to try it.
meanings.sent4: The strangeness of the customs in the foreign land fascinated her.
meanings.sent5: The strangeness of the ritual intrigued the anthropologists.

meanings.definition: The quality of being strange or unusual.
meanings.sent1: The artist's paintings were known for their strangeness.
meanings.sent2: The strangeness of the weather patterns puzzled the meteorologists.
meanings.sent3: The strangeness of the plant's growth pattern caught the gardener off guard.
meanings.sent4: The strangeness of the phenomenon defied scientific explanation.
meanings.sent5: The strangeness of the artifact made it a valuable discovery.
